organization: Dynamics Research Corporation (acquired by Engility Corporation)
title: Software Developer III
summary: DBA and application maintenance for USAF; modernization work, data interfaces, and SQL Server administration.
responsibilities: Migrated an ASP Classic application to ASP.NET; also completed a rewrite using ASP.NET 2.0 features (including custom/user controls) and built a 508 accessibility interface using ASP.NET 2.0 profile features.
Built an ASP.NET + T-SQL web-based data interface between Oracle scheduling and the SQL Server database feeding a simulation model; included tools/reports for exceptions and interface scenarios.
Modernized ASP Classic UI using CSS and web standards to reduce HTML size/complexity and improve maintainability (using CMMI repeatable processes).
Provided ongoing DTS troubleshooting support for monthly data warehouse updates; upgraded import packages from DTS to SSIS.
Implemented new metrics/levels of detail in MERLIN; refactored T-SQL queries to reduce lines of code ~5Ã— for Weapon System Availability tasking.
Automated SQL Server backups/admin scripts; implemented monitoring/notification for data warehouse health.
Installed/configured a SharePoint issue tracker for a geographically distributed dev team; used in live production.
Built prototype Analysis Services cubes and MDX proof-of-concept for high-performance BI querying.
Collaborated to repair/stabilize VSS repositories and prevent loss of historical source code; set up Subversion for migration.
Created developer documentation: data dictionary, API documentation, and comprehensive web-based user documentation for a data interface tool.
